subject: RE: [junit] using JUnit for UI testing?
msgSnippet: Andy, I d take a look at: http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0002/index.shtml http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0001/index.shtml
messageBody:
Andy,

I'd take a look at:

http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0002/index.shtml
http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0001/index.shtml
http://www.c2.com/cgi/wiki?GuiTesting

to handle "eyes on" I've played around with the java.awt.Robot class out of
JDK1.3. The results of my playing can be seen here:
http://www.geekfarm.org/emeade/junit/GuiJunit.zip
it's alpha, so not for the faint of heart. I have some examples of testing
the Swing JUnit 3.2 included.

--
Erik Meade emeade@objectmentor.com
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andy Kriger [mailto:akriger@triene.com]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 28, 2001 7:29 AM
> To: JUnit
> Subject: [junit] using JUnit for UI testing?
>
> Is anyone out there using JUnit for UI testing? Can you describe the
> framework you have created to accomplish this? At a certain point UI test
> requires eyes on the product but how much have you been able to test up to
> that point?
>
> thx
